fields.Name: #DataRescueCHI Save Climate Research on Earth Day
fields.Description:
Attending a DataRescue is an excellent alternative to take action on Earth Day in lieu of participating on the marches going on during the weekend. We've also added DataRescue organizer training to the agenda so more and more people can organize these events.

Date: 10:00 am – 4:00 pm CDT, Saturday, April 22, 2017
Location: Fisk Hall, Northwestern University, 1845 Sheridan Rd, Evanston, IL
RSVP: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/save-climate-research-on-earth-day-datarescuechi-registration-33158228153

fields.Name: DataRescue Boston @ MIT
fields.Description:
DataRescue at MIT is a hackathon focused on identifying, downloading, processing, and mirroring federal research data at risk of being taken down or obscured by the current administration. The event is being hosted by MIT ACSES, MIT Libraries, and The Environmental Data & Governance Initiative -EDGI, with support from MIT Graduate Student Council - GSC and MIT Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering.

This event is part of a larger DataRescue Boston movement http://datarescue-boston.github.io/, which includes events and collaborators at Harvard, Tufts, and Northeastern

Date: 8:30 am - 5:00 pm Saturday, February 18, 2017
Location: MIT Walker Memorial Bldg, 142 Memorial Dr, Cambridge, MA
RSVP: https://datarescue-boston.github.io/ or https://www.facebook.com/events/1625484311094707/

fields.Name: DataRescueDavis at UC Davis
fields.Description:
Help preserve scientific research! Join us for #DataRescueDavis, where we will work together to backup scientific data related to climate change and the environment that was produced with public funding and is available from federal websites. #DataRescueDavis is part of the nationwide #DataRefuge project, in collaboration with the Environmental Data & Governance Initiative and the Internet Archive’s End of Term project.

Date: 10 am - 4 pm, Thursday, February 2, 2017
Location: Davis campus, Peter J. Shields Library, Third Floor
Data Science Initiative classroom (Room 360) 

RSVP: http://guides.lib.ucdavis.edu/aiap_events

fields.Name: DataRescueNH Harvesting Workshop
fields.Description:
Join us for an archiving skill-building workshop. We will be teaching attendees how to do web scraping to "harvest" uncrawable URLs and upload them to the Internet Archive's End of Term Project. Previous skills in R and Python are recommended for this workshop. Knowledge of HTML is helpful.

Date: 6:00 - 9:00 pm EST, Friday, March 10, 2017
Location: PLAN: The Post-Landfill Action Network, 1 Washington St, Dover, NH
RSVP: https://www.facebook.com/events/132180217305410/

fields.Name: DataRescue Twin Cities, MN
fields.Description:
As part of our commitment to keeping data open, accessible, and available, the University of Minnesota Libraries is hosting a DataRescue Event in the Twin Cities on February 24 and 25. Join us in our efforts to capture and archive federally produced datasets to ensure they remain available.

The mission of DataRescue-Twin Cities is to preserve, promote, and protect federally produced data. These data are critical for research, policy decisions, and an informed citizenry, but their availability are particularly vulnerable to changes in government funding and administrative policy.

Date: 1:00 - 6:00 pm, February 24 – 25, 2017
Location: Humphrey School of Public Affairs, Room 50B, 301 19th Ave S, Minneapolis, MN
RSVP: https://www.lib.umn.edu/about/datarescue/ or https://www.facebook.com/events/223317941409060/

fields.Name: DataRescue Chapel Hill
fields.Description:
Join us for a DataRescue event, with support from the School of Information and Library Science and University Library at UNC-Chapel Hill. In collaboration with DataRefuge, EDGI and the Internet Archive’s End of Term 2016 project, DataRescue Chapel Hill aims to preserve online information and data related to climate change and environmental programs that are identified as high risk for removal from online public access or even deleted.

Date: 10:00 am - 4:00 pm, March 4, 2017
Location: Davis Library, 208 Raleigh St, Chapel Hill, NC
RSVP: http://datarescue.web.unc.edu/ or https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScuEJlqbIDS_X3N6q6jNH3wWEJB_9Aj6J-9enZ7dSzu6JdbFA/viewform

fields.Name: DataRescue SFbay
fields.Description:
#DataRescueSFBay is an opportunity for programmers, scientists, archivists, activists, and volunteers of all kinds to identify, back-up, and help preserve publicly accessible federal data resources in the public interest, in the event they are removed from public view and use.

Date: 9am - 5pm Saturday, February 11, 2017
Location: Berkeley Institute for Data Science, at 190 Doe Library in Berkeley, CA
RSVP: http://datarescuesfbay.org/

fields.Name: DataRefuge Austin
fields.Description:
#DataRescueATX is an opportunity for civic hackers, scientists, activists, and volunteers of all kinds to identify, back-up, and help preserve at-risk federal data resources in the public interest.

Date: 2:00 - 6:00 pm CST February 10 – 11, 2017
Location: fibercove inc., 1700 Lamar Blvd S, Ste 338, Austin, TX
RSVP: https://www.facebook.com/events/361727474196355/

fields.Name: ChiHackNight DataRescue Breakout
fields.Description:
Breakout tool building session in Chicago at Chi Hack Night 
https://chihacknight.org/

Breakout session details: https://github.com/chihacknight/breakout-groups/issues/69 

Date: January 17, 2017
Location: Braintree

fields.Name: DataRescueIndy 2
fields.Description:
#DataRefugeIndy invites you to participate in an important citizen science project to archive and code federal climate and environmental data on March 8, 2017.

#DataRefugeIndy (part of the #DataRefuge consortium based at the University of Pennsylvania) recognizes that evidence for ongoing human-induced climate and environmental change is overwhelmingly supported by the scientific community and backed by decades of data-driven analysis. Much of this analysis has relied on the important climate and environmental data sets stored on federal servers. Continued reliable access to these data sets is vital to ongoing climate and environmental research. However, there is no guarantee that this federal data will remain accessible to researchers and the public into the future.

Date: 11:00 am - 6:00 pm EST, Wednesday, March 8, 2017
Location: IUPUI University Library, 755 W Michigan St, Indianapolis, IN
RSVP: https://www.facebook.com/datarefugeindy/ or https://www.facebook.com/events/1153027514810037/

fields.Name: DataRescue Chicago
fields.Description:
We believe in supporting the fundamental role of science in sound government policy. Please help us preserve federal climate and environmental data that's vulnerable under an administration that denies the fact of ongoing climate change. We must ensure that this valuable data continues to be publicly accessible.

Date: 11am - 4pm CST, Saturday, March 11, 2017
Location: Polsky Exchange North, 1452 E 53rd St, Promontory Point Room, Chicago, IL
RSVP: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/save-climate-research-datarescuechi-tickets-32243971587

fields.Name: #DataRescueDenton
fields.Description:
DataRescue is a one-day hack-a-thon type event welcome to volunteers from all backgrounds and technical abilities.
Part of UNT's Open Acccess Symposium 2017 will be held the May 18–19 at the University of North Texas New College at Frisco (https://openaccess.unt.edu/symposium/2017).

While the Internet Archive has been able to archive many government websites, it is unable to archive other types of information, particularly datasets. DataRescue events are a key piece in ensuring that these datasets are copied. The Internet Archive, datarefuge.org and a consortium of research libraries hold these copies and keep them available for public access.

Date: Saturday, May 20, 2017
Location: Stoke, 608 E Hickory St #128, Denton, TX 
RSVP: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/data-rescue-denton-tickets-33553688987#tickets or http://datarescuedenton.com/

fields.Name: #A2DataRescue, Ann Arbor
fields.Description:
A citizen science event to preserve vulnerable government data, especially data about climate change and the environment. Part of the national data refuge project and in conjunction with the end of term presidential harvest from the internet archive.

Date: 10am - 6pm, Friday January 27 and Saturday January 28
Location: Shapiro Design Lab
Shapiro Undergraduate Library, University of Michigan
919 South University Ave, Ann Arbor, MI 48109
RSVP: https://www.a2datarescue.com/

WHAT YOU SHOULD BRING 
Laptops, chargers, and enthusiasm! Snacks, drinks, and lunch will be provided.

WHO SHOULD COME
Developers, archivists, librarians, scientists, documentarians, data specialists, and anyone else who wants to help.
No tech experience is required.

WHY THIS IS IMPORTANT
With every administration change, there is a loss of digital content due to the lack of a comprehensive strategy for preserving digital government information. The new Presidential administration, however, presents a level of urgency to this problem, with a feeling of at best ambiguity and at worst threat to the study of specific research areas. (See the Data Refuge bibliography for more details.) This is especially true of materials related to climate change and the environment, though other areas may also be at risk. The Data Refuge project is an attempt to preserve these vulnerable data sets and address the larger problem of born-digital government information. 

FOR MORE INFORMATION, PLEASE CONTACT A2datarescue@gmail.com

fields.Name: DataRescue NYC
fields.Description:
Hosted by New York University, Data Rescue NYC is run by the Environmental Data and Governance Initiative (EDGI) in collaboration with the PPEHlab’s DataRefuge project. It is part of a decentralized effort including previous events in Toronto, Philadelphia, Los Angeles and elsewhere.

Data Rescue NYC works to secure federal environmental data in advance of the Trump administration’s large-scale efforts to dismantle environmental regulation. This work is urgent since the Trump administration has vowed to cull crucial data from its websites.

Date: Saturay, February 4, 2017
Location: Integrated Telecommunications Program, Tisch School of the Arts, 4th Floor, 721 Broadway, New York, NY
RSVP: https://datarescuenyc.com/ and https://goo.gl/forms/hW5OGoyjE08TpvD92
FB event: https://www.facebook.com/events/704371486406298

fields.Name: DataRescue Houston
fields.Description:
Data Rescue Houston brings together programmers, librarians, scientists, students, archivists, technologists, and other volunteers to identify, download, and help preserve federal data resources at risk of being removed from the public web, protecting the public interest and ensuring their long-term accessibility.

Date: 9:30am - 5:30pm CST, Saturday, March 4, 2017
Location: Kyle Morrow Room, 3rd floor, Fondren Library, Rice University, 6100 Main St, Houston, TX
RSVP: https://datarescuehouston.wordpress.com/

fields.Name: DataRescue Oregon @ OSU
fields.Description:
Oregon State University Data Refuge Event

Date: 8:00 am - 1:00 pm PST, Friday, March 17, 2017
Location: Valley Library, Oregon State University, 1500 SW Jefferson St, Corvallis, OR
RSVP: http://calendar.oregonstate.edu/event/123450/

fields.Name: #DataRescueRTP, Research Triangle Park Primer Writing
fields.Description:
To prepare for the Data Rescue event, DataRescueRTP will be hosting a Primer Writing Event on Monday, May 15, 2017 in two sessions from 3:00pm-5:30pm or from 5:30pm-7:30pm in Davis Library, 208 Raleigh Road, Chapel Hill on the UNC Campus. The purpose of these events will be to identify endangered data and for experts in the field to identify URLs for at-risk data sets. Subject specialists in housing and urban development, education, and health and human services will be necessary to write primers.

Date: Monday, May 15, 2017, 3:00 - 7:30 pm
Location: Manning Hall, Rm 001, 216 Lenoir Drive, Chapel Hill, NC 
RSVP: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSf3kkw27bh6aYt655bkJi0C92fZ3JGAQ44MCz_eyNrhGSgVdw/viewform

fields.Name: #DataRescuePGH @ Pittsburgh
fields.Description:
#DataRescuePGH is an opportunity for programmers, scientists, librarians, activists, and volunteers of all kinds to identify, back-up, and help preserve publicly accessible federal data resources, in the event they are removed from federal websites and public view. The goal of #DataRescuePGH and its sister events throughout the country is to ensure continued access to vulnerable data in the public interest through trustworthy archives.

Date: 12 - 5 pm, April 2, 2017
Location: Carnegie Library of Pittsburgh Main branch, 4400 Forbes Ave, Pittsburgh, PA
RSVP: https://datarescuepgh.wordpress.com/

fields.Name: DataRescueIndy
fields.Description:
#DataRefugeIndy invites you to participate in an important citizen science project to archive and code federal climate and environmental data.

Date: 12:00 PM - 6:00 PM EST, Thursday, January 19 at 
Location: IUPUI University Library
755 W Michigan St, Indianapolis, IN 46202
RSVP: https://www.facebook.com/events/358268607865735/

fields.Name: DataRescue Haverford
fields.Description:
DataRescue Haverford is an opportunity to identify, back-up, and help preserve at-risk federal science data in collaboration with the DataRefuge project. Trico students, faculty, staff, and guests are welcome. If you are concerned about the long-term future of federally funded climate and environmental research data, please help us to preserve it. You can contribute by choosing a role that fits your skills and interests. Some roles require no technical skills whatsoever, while others require hacking and coding skills. Guidance will be provided by Trico librarians, staff, and faculty on the day of the event.

Date: 10am – 4pm, Saturday, February 18, 2017
Location: Magill Library Lobby, Haverford College, 370 Lancaster Avenue, Haverford, PA
RSVP: http://ds.haverford.edu/datarescue/

fields.Name: DataRescue Albuquerque
fields.Description:
The University of New Mexico Libraries Research Data Services will be hosting the first #datarescueabq event on Wednesday, April 5. In coordination with DataRefuge and other Data Rescue participants nationwide, librarians will provide background into the importance of preserving federal climate, land use, and other data. Following training in the use of tools provided by the PPEHLab’s DataRefuge initiative and EDGI, the Environmental Data & Governance Initiative, participants will work to identify high value datasets and seed web pages for harvest by the Internet Archive. The particular focus of this will event will be on websites and data published by DOE National Laboratories.

Date: April 5, 2017
Location: Centennial Science & Engineering Library, Albuquerque, NM
RSVP: https://datarescue-albuquerque.github.io/

fields.Name: DataResue Raleigh
fields.Description:
Have you been wondering what this hacktivist hubbub about data rescue is all about? Join our resident expert librarians in web archiving for this special Endangered Data Week event and find out! Learn to locate public data sets, what endangered data is, and what organizations are involved in data rescue work. This workshop will introduce students to topics such as web archiving and what it means to archive a website versus a dataset and will provide them with time to get hands on experience. Immediately after, join student groups for Data Rescue 102 to get hands-on experience in a data rescue marathon.

Date: 4:00pm - 8:00pm, April 20, 2017 
Location: Fishbowl Forum, D. H. Hill Library, 2 Broughton Drive Campus, Raleigh, NC
RSVP and Details: https://www.lib.ncsu.edu/workshop/data-rescue-101-what-why-and-how and https://www.lib.ncsu.edu/event/data-rescue-102-save-all-the-things

fields.Name: #DataRescueATX @ UT Austin
fields.Description:
Help Save Federal Data at the #DataRescueATX Event! The federal government’s data belongs to you. Right now, that data (particularly on the climate and environment) is at risk for suppression and deletion for political reasons. 

The #DataRescueATX event is an opportunity for programmers, scientists, librarians, writers, activists and volunteers of all kinds to build community around fact-based arguments. Pizza and training will be provided, but please bring your own laptop and charger!

Date: 12:00 – 6:00 pm, March 3, 2017
Location: UT Austin iSchool, 1616 Guadalupe Street, Austin, TX
RSVP: https://datarescue-austin.github.io/ or https://www.eventbrite.com/e/datarescue-austin-at-ut-tickets-32341815240#

fields.Name: DataResue Oxford, OH @ Miami University
fields.Description:
The Miami University Libraries held a Data Rescue Event to collect and archive data that is at risk including government data sites.

Date: 10 am - 5 pm, March 4, 2017
Location: Miami University Libraries, 151 South Campus Avenue, Oxford, OH
RSVP: http://infoscreens.lib.miamioh.edu/public_html/DataRescue.html

fields.Name: The DataRefuge Project at the University of Oregon
fields.Description: On saturday morning people from across the University of Oregon campus and the Eugene area join a crowdsourcing public humanities meetup.

fields.Name: #DataRescueRTP, Research Triangle Park
fields.Description:
In partnership with DataRescue Chapel Hill, the National Humanities Center will be hosting a Data Rescue event in Research Triangle Park (RTP). Data Rescue events attempt to archive endangered federal datasets or other government information to protect it from disappearing. The events originally targeted climate change and other environmental data; however, the RTP event is searching for subject specialists to identify at-risk data in education, housing, public health, and other fields.


Date: Saturday and Sunday, June 10-11, 2017, 10am to 2pm
Location: National Humanities Center Library, Durham, NC 
RSVP: datarescueRTP@gmail.com

fields.Name: DataRescue New Haven 2 @ Yale
fields.Description:
Join us for a half-day event as we locate data to archive from the federal government and find ways to archive what web crawlers cannot grab. The best part is that you don't need programming skills to participate — just the ability to use the Internet.

The event will begin at 1 PM in the Center for Science and Social Science Information at 219 Prospect Street. CSSSI is located on the concourse/basement level of the building.

Date: 1:00 pm – 5:00 pm EDT, April 8, 2017
Location: Yale Center for Science and Social Science Information Computer Classroom 219 Prospect Street New Haven, CT
RSVP: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/april-data-rescue-new-haven-yale-registration-33090570788

fields.Name: DataRescue Boston @ Northeastern
fields.Description:

Date: March 24, 2017
Location: Snell Library, 360 Huntington Ave, Boston, MA
RSVP: https://datarescue-boston.github.io/northeastern/

fields.Name: DataRescue Boulder
fields.Description:
Data Rescue Boulder focuses on archiving and saving dataset information that would be of interest, or of critical need to the CU Boulder and local scientific community and which is part of the public data that is quickly disappearing from access.  Data created and used by agencies such as the EPA, NOAA, CDC, and the CENSUS Bureau.

WE NEED YOUR HELP!
CU Boulder is not only an excellent academic setting for students to learn about science and the environment, but is unique in that it has immediate access to many local federal science-based organizations, such as the EPA, and NOAA.

Date: February 18-19, 2017
Location: CU Law Library, 2405 Kittredge Loop Dr, Boulder, CO
RSVP: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/data-rescue-boulder-tickets-31995428187 or https://www.facebook.com/Data-Rescue-Boulder-410417079296635/

fields.Name: DataRescue Boulder
fields.Description:
Data Rescue Boulder focuses on archiving and saving dataset information that would be of interest, or of critical need to the CU Boulder and local scientific community and which is part of the public data that is quickly disappearing from access.  Data created and used by agencies such as the EPA, NOAA, CDC, and the CENSUS Bureau.

WE NEED YOUR HELP!
CU Boulder is not only an excellent academic setting for students to learn about science and the environment, but is unique in that it has immediate access to many local federal science-based organizations, such as the EPA, and NOAA.

Specifically we will be using this workflow model developed at the first DataRescue event in Philadelphia, and which has been further refined at events in Los Angeles, Chicago and Ann Arbor.

#DataRescueATX is an opportunity for civic hackers, scientists, activists, and volunteers of all kinds to identify, back-up, and help preserve at-risk federal data resources in the public interest.

fields.Name: DataRescue Los Angeles
fields.Description:

Data Rescue Los Angeles will be held on 11 March, from 11:30am-6pm at Indie Desk in Downtown Los Angeles. Feel free to arrive late or leave early — we appreciate any time you can volunteer for this event. Please bring your own laptop. We will provide, coffee, refreshments, and snacks.

Location: Indie Desk, 333 S Grand Ave #450, Los Angeles, CA
RSVP: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/data-rescue-los-angeles-tickets-32520081439

fields.Name: DataRescue New Hampshire
fields.Description:
DataRescueNH is a civic-minded hackathon focused on preserving at risk federal data and webpages. All levels of technical experience welcome. We are launching #DataRescueNH to culminate #LoveYourDataWeek 2017. This event collaborates with #DataRefuge, The Environmental Data & Governance Initiative -EDGI, and the Internet Archive’s End of Term 2016 project to archive at-risk federal online pages and data. Data Rescue NYC-2 is working to secure crucial federal data from the agencies within the USDA. We welcome web-savvy comrades in information technology, archiving and environmental science and policy to join us for a day of preserving valuable agricultural/scientific/environmental data.

Co-organized by JSTOR and the Qualitative Data Repository of Syracuse University.

fields.Description:
Over the course of two days datarescueDC will help to seed, sort, harvest, and store valuable and at risk federal government data in Data Refuge, a project facilitated by the University of Pennsylvania’s Program in Environmental Humanities. Specifically we will be using this workflow model developed at the first DataRescue event in Philadelphia, and which has been further refined at events in Los Angeles, Chicago and Ann Arbor.

fields.Name: DataRescue Boston @ Harvard
fields.Description:
The first Boston DataRescue event will be held on Wednesday February 1 from 4:30pm - 9:30pm in the CGIS South Building Room S030 at Harvard University. We'll be focusing on archiving websites and data from NASA: Earth Science and the Department of Energy.

The event is being organized by Toly Rinberg, Andrew Bergman and Maya Anjur-Dietrich, all members of the Environmental Data & Governance Initiative (EDGI) and PhD students in Applied Physics, Mercè Crosas, Chief Data Science and Technology Officer at the Institute for Quantitative Social Science (IQSS), and Hugh Truslow, Head of Social Sciences and Visualization at Harvard Library, all from Harvard University.

Date: 4:30 - 9:30pm
Location: CGIS South Building, Room S030, Harvard University, 1737 Cambridge St, Cambridge, MA

fields.Name: DataRescue Seattle
fields.Description:
Digital data is easy to distribute, but can disappear easily when websites change. Join the University of Washington Libraries, the City of Seattle, Seattle Data for Good, and others for a one-day event as we locate data to archive from the federal government and find ways to archive what web crawlers cannot grab.

Data Rescue Seattle will be held at the University of Washington on February 25, from 12pm-6:30pm in the Odegaard Undergraduate Library. Feel free to arrive late or leave early -- we appreciate any time you can volunteer for this event. Please bring your own laptop.

Date: 12:00 – 6:30 pm PST, February 25, 2017
Location: Odegaard Undergraduate Library, 4060 George Washington Lane Northeast, Seattle, WA
RSVP: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/seattle-data-rescue-event-tickets-32105338933

fields.Name: DataRescueMadison Climate Hackathon
fields.Description:
Join us for the first #DataRescueMadison hackathon event, facilitated by #LeadingLocally. We can build a refuge for federal climate and environmental data vulnerable under an administration that denies the fact of ongoing climate change. We are committed to fact-based arguments, and #DataRefuge works to preserve the facts we all need.

Date: 1 - 4 pm CST, Sunday, March 5, 2017
Location: Sector67, 2100 Winnebago St, Madison, WI
RSVP: https://www.facebook.com/events/1814020465528122

fields.Name: DataRescue WUSTL, St. Louis
fields.Description:
April 14, 2017 at Washington University in St. Louis
#DataRescueWU is an opportunity for programmers, scientists, archivists, activists, and volunteers of all kinds to identify, back-up, and help preserve publicly accessible federal data resources in the public interest.

Join us for a day of civic technology and citizen archiving, at a time when scientific research in the public interest is increasingly at risk.

Date: 9 am - 4:30 pm, April 14, 2017
Location: GIS Classroom, Room 308, Rudolph Hall, Department of Earth and Planetary Sciences, St. Louis, MO
RSVP: https://datarescuewu.github.io/ or http://wustl.libcal.com/event/3212706

fields.Name: DataRescue Twin Cities, MN
fields.Description:
As part of our commitment to keeping data open, accessible, and available, the University of Minnesota Libraries is hosting a DataRescue Event in the Twin Cities on February 24 and 25. Join us in our efforts to capture and archive federally produced datasets to ensure they remain available.

The mission of DataRescue-Twin Cities is to preserve, promote, and protect federally produced data. These data are critical for research, policy decisions, and an informed citizenry, but their availability are particularly vulnerable to changes in government funding and administrative policy.

Date: 1:00 - 6:00 pm, February 24 – 25, 2017
Location: Humphrey School of Public Affairs, Room 50B, 301 19th Ave S, Minneapolis, MN
RSVP: https://www.lib.umn.edu/about/datarescue/ or https://www.facebook.com/events/223317941409060/
